content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here is an example of how you can solve this problem using regular expressions in Julia.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    questions = [] # Array to store all questions
    answers = []   # Array to store all answers
    lines = split(md, "\n")  # Split markdown text into individual lines
    
    in_question = false # Flag to track if we're currently inside a question section
    in_answer = false   # Flag to track if we're currently inside an answer section

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "# Question")
            in_question = true
            continue  # Ignore the current line and move on to the next one
        elseif startswith(line, "# Answer")
            in_answer = true
            continue
        end
        
        if in_question && !isempty(line)
            push!(questions, rstrip(line))  # Push the stripped line into our question array
            in_question = false  # Stop collecting lines for this question section
        elseif in_answer && !isempty(line)
            push!(answers, rstrip(line))    # Push the stripped line into our answer array
            in_answer = false              # Stop collecting lines for this answer section
        end
    end
    
    return (join(questions, " "), join(answers, " "))  # Combine all lines into a single string and return as a tuple.
end
```
Please note that this function assumes that every question is followed by its corresponding answer in the markdown text. If your markdown might have questions and answers interspersed or if there are multiple questions/answers per section, you'll need to adjust the function accordingly.
